alert.note: Alert for San Jacinto (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 11:40AM CDT until May 15 at 6:08PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria, Chambers, Galveston, Harris, Liberty, Montgomery, San Jacinto and Walker. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1140 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pasadena, eastern Pearland, northwestern Baytown, Conroe, Friendswood, Deer Park, Alvin, South Houston, Humble, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Webster, Cleveland, Willis, eastern Manvel, Spring, Kingwood, The Woodlands, Barrett and Greater Fifth Ward. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when yo30u can do so safely.
